children.name: upload
children.description: Fires when one or more files are about to be uploaded.Canceling the event will prevent the upload.> The upload event fires only when the upload is in[async mode](/web/upload/modes#asynchronous-mode).> It is possible to change the saveUrl at this point.

children.name: success
children.description: Fires when an upload / remove operation has been completed successfully.Note: The success event fires only when the upload is in[async mode](/web/upload/modes#asynchronous-mode).

children.name: select
Wire-up an event handler that triggered when a user selects a file(s)

children.description: Triggered when a file(s) is selected. Note: Cancelling this event will prevent the selection fromoccurring.

children.name: remove
children.description: Fires when an uploaded file is about to be removed.Cancelling the event will prevent the remove.

children.name: progress
children.description: Fires when upload progress data is available.Note: The progress event fires only when the upload is in[async mode](/web/upload/modes#asynchronous-mode).Note: The progress event is not fired in IE.See [Supported Browsers](/web/upload/supported-browsers)

children.name: error
children.description: Fires when an upload / remove operation has failed.Note: The error event fires only when the upload is in[async mode](/web/upload/modes#asynchronous-mode).

children.name: complete
children.description: Fires when all active uploads have completed either successfully or with errors.Note: The complete event fires only when the upload is in[async mode](/web/upload/modes#asynchronous-mode).

children.name: cancel
children.description: Fires when the upload has been cancelled while in progress.Note: The cancel event fires only when the upload is in[async mode](/web/upload/modes#asynchronous-mode).

children.name: toggle
children.description: Toggles the upload enabled state.

children.name: enable

parameters.name: enable `Boolean` *(optional)*
parameters.description: The argument, which defines whether to enable/disable the upload.

children.description: Enables the upload.

children.name: disable
children.description: Disables the upload.

children.name: destroy
children.description: Prepares the **Upload** for safe removal from DOM. Detaches all event handlers and removes jQuery.data attributes to avoid memory leaks. Calls destroy method of any child Kendo widgets.> **Important:** This method does not remove the Upload element from DOM.

children.name: template
Example - specify template as a string
Example - specify template as a function

children.description: The [template](/api/javascript/kendo#methods-template) used to render the files in the list

children.name: showFileList
children.description: Enables (**true**) or disables (**false**) the ability to display a file listingfor uploading a file(s). Disabling a file listing may be useful you wish to customize the UI; use theclient-side events to build your own UI.

children.name: multiple
children.description: Enables (**true**) or disables (**false**) the ability to select multiple files.If **false**, users will be able to select only one file at a time. Note: This option does notlimit the total number of uploaded files in an asynchronous configuration.

children.name: localization.uploadSelectedFiles
children.description: Sets the text of the "Upload files" button.

children.name: localization.statusUploading
children.description: Sets the status message for files that are being uploaded.

children.name: localization.statusUploaded
children.description: Sets the status message for uploaded files.

children.name: localization.statusFailed
children.description: Sets the status message for failed uploads.

children.name: localization.select
children.description: Sets the "Select..." button text.

children.name: localization.retry
children.description: Sets the text of the retry button text.

children.name: localization.remove
children.description: Sets the text of the remove button text.

children.name: localization.headerStatusUploading
children.description: Sets the header status message for files that are being uploaded.

children.name: localization.headerStatusUploaded
children.description: Sets the header status message for uploaded files.

children.name: localization.dropFilesHere
children.description: Sets the drop zone hint.

children.name: localization.cancel
children.description: Sets the text of the cancel button text.

children.name: localization
children.description: Sets the strings rendered by the Upload.

children.name: files.size
children.description: The size of the initial file.

children.name: files.name
children.description: The name of the initial file.

children.name: files.extension
children.description: The extension of the initial file.

children.name: files
Example - passing an array of initial files
Each file object in the array should contain the following properties

children.description: List of files to be initially rendered in the Upload widget files list.

children.name: enabled
children.description: Enables (**true**) or disables (**false**) an **Upload**. A disabled**Upload** may be re-enabled via enable().

children.name: async.withCredentials
children.description: Controls whether to send credentials (cookies, headers) for cross-site requests.This option will be ignored if the browser doesn't support File API.

children.name: async.saveUrl
children.description: The URL of the handler that will receive the submitted files. The handler must accept POST requestscontaining one or more fields with the same name as the original input name.

children.name: async.saveField
children.description: The name of the form field submitted to the save URL. The default value is the input name.

children.name: async.removeVerb
children.description: The HTTP verb to be used by the remove action.

children.name: async.removeUrl
children.description: The URL of the handler responsible for removing uploaded files (if any). The handler must accept POSTrequests containing one or more "fileNames" fields specifying the files to be deleted.

children.name: async.removeField
children.description: The name of the form field submitted to the Remove URL.

children.name: async.batch
children.description: The selected files will be uploaded in separate requests, if this is supported by the browser.You can change this behavior by setting batch to true, in which case all selected files will be uploaded in one request.The batch mode applies to multiple files, which are selected at the same time.Files selected one after the other will be uploaded in separate requests.

children.name: async.autoUpload
children.description: The selected files will be uploaded immediately by default. You can change this behavior by setting `autoUpload` to false.

children.name: async
children.description: Configures the ability to upload a file(s) in an asynchronous manner. Please refer to the[async mode help topic](/web/upload/modes#asynchronous-mode)for more details.
